item.description:
Boston Nonprofit Networking & Leadership Series

"I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles; but today it means getting along with people."
Mohandas Gandhi

•Looking to increase your professional network in the nonprofit space?
•Want to learn from a proven nonprofit leader new strategies that could help develop your career?
•Would it be helpful to hear three new career develop strategies from an expert?
•Open to helping your career and a local nonprofits grow?

If you answered YES to any or all of these then this event is a great match for you!

Video Testimonial:
http://www.youtube.co...

Meetup Bonus: Everyone you signs-up on this site get my book for FREE - Strategic Volunteering: 50 Ingredients to Transform Your Life and Career

50% of all gross profits from event go to help AFC mentoring empower youth in foster care to flourish through committed mentor matches. One match changes two lives! For the month of January when you purchase the book Strategic Volunteering: 50 Ingredients to Transform Your Life and Career we will donate 50% of the proceeds to AFC mentoring. You can invest in the book and AFC here - http://thenonprofitca....

You could walk home with a donation to your favorite charity or a handmade gift from Colombia South America as well.

Highlight Speaker and Nonprofit for January

Learn how Colby Berger turned around AFC Mentoring through her leadership in 2010!

A few of the highlight were: More than doubled the number of youth served, increased the size and scope of funding base, rejuvenated state contract, developed new partnerships with local child welfare providers, increased and expanded corporate partnerships, begun a new program for youth aging out of foster care, and hosted the first ever gala event!

More on Ms. Berger, as a former educator, Colby earned a Master’s Degree in Education from Harvard University, and later turned her focus to child welfare and social services earning a Master’s degree in Social Work from the Simmons School of Social Work. Colby came to AFC after working at The Home for Little Wanderers for seven years where she opened and oversaw a group home for LGBTQ teenagers, did clinical work in adoption and family stabilization team services, facilitated support groups for foster and adoptive families, and provided training and consultation nationwide on sexual orientation and gender identity issues.

$10 per person pre-registered or $15 at the door
This is a wonderful event for professionals at all levels including, coordinators, directors, board members and staff of nonprofits to learn some career development tools, meet, find out what each are doing, and of course have some FUN!


Testimonials:
http://www.youtube.co...

“I met some great people who were willing to share ideas and thoughts. Everyone wants to help - it really is a win/win situation. ” - Danielle

“A good group of experienced professionals with diversified expertise but one thing in common: enthusiasm for social changes. Clear agenda, well organized meeting. People are genuinely willing to help each other. I can see great ideas forming and real collaborations happening. ” - Jing

Can't make this date check out Networking for Non-Profits on the South Shore event on 1/19/11
http://networkingnp-1...


PS. Remember to bring your own name tag this will help brand your organization more effectively.

Sponsors of the event:

The Nonprofit Career Coach a division of Jobs In Nonprofits (http://www.thenonprof...) and Simply Be Creative (http://simplybecreati...)
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a name tag - Bring your own name tag please!
